definition: to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: I hate to memorize phrases with fixed prepositions from books.
sentences.chinese: 我很痛恨從書本上強記需要配上固定介係詞的片語。

sentences.english: They are usually called Conquering Prepositions or Conquering Phrases and the like.
sentences.chinese: 那些書通常是戰勝介係詞或戰勝片語之類的書名。

sentences.english: He has made a detailed study of the use of prepositions .
sentences.chinese: 他對介係詞用法作了一番詳盡的研究。

sentences.english: Articles and prepositions are stumbling blocks to the beginners of English.
sentences.chinese: 冠詞和介係詞對英文初學者來說是個絆腳石。
